VentureBeat 2025-01-10

Multi-Agent Systems Are Eating Software Development

Enterprise AI teams are moving beyond single LLM calls to orchestrated agent workflows, with early adopters seeing 10x productivity gains.
TechCrunch 2025-01-08

Why Agent Orchestration Will Define 2026

VCs are betting billions on agent infrastructure. The control layer for autonomous AI is the next platform shift.
InfoQ 2025-01-05

The Control Plane Problem in AI Systems

As AI systems scale, coordinating hundreds of specialized agents becomes the bottleneck. Infrastructure tooling is years behind demand.
Forbes 2024-12-28

Enterprise AI Adoption Hits Inflection Point

Fortune 500 companies are deploying agent teams internally. The race is on to build reliable orchestration frameworks.
Gartner 2024-12-20

Gartner Predicts Agentic AI Will Disrupt 60% of Workflows by 2027

New research shows coordinated AI agents will replace traditional automation in most enterprise workflows within three years.
MIT Technology Review 2024-12-15

Google DeepMind Announces Multi-Agent Research Initiative

Major AI lab pivots to agent coordination challenges, citing orchestration as the next frontier in artificial intelligence.
a16z 2024-12-10

Why Software 3.0 Is Agent-Native Architecture

Andreessen Horowitz publishes thesis on agent-first development paradigm. Infrastructure layer is wide open for disruption.
OPERATIONAL 2025-01-12

Festival Methodology Released

Complete project planning system for AI agents now available. Phases, sequences, tasks. Steps, not time.

IN PROGRESS 2025-01-09

Multi-Provider Agent Orchestration

Provider-agnostic agent execution entering final testing. OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama support confirmed.

OPERATIONAL 2025-01-06

Fest CLI Core Commands Stable

Create, validate, progress tracking commands production-ready. Agents can now plan autonomously.

IN PROGRESS 2024-12-30

Persistent Session Architecture

Long-running agent sessions with context preservation. SQLite storage, cross-session recall.

OPERATIONAL 2024-12-22

Obey Reference Complete

Monolith implementation validated. Core patterns extracted for modular deployment.

CLASSIFIED 2024-12-18

Hierarchical Agent Coordination

Internal research into campaign-level orchestration. Results inform v2 architecture.

ARCHIVED 2024-12-12

Foundation Components Deployed

Core infrastructure operational. Festival methodology, scaffold tool, chat interface all deployed.

Obey

Hierarchical execution that scales.
Be the CEO of your agents.

About Obey

Hundreds of agents. One window. Run an AI organization at executive scale.

Like managing 20 teams without managing any of them directly. The complexity of each team is abstracted away.

Be the executive. Not the manager.

The Scale Problem

The industry is racing to build smarter models. That’s not the problem.

We already have AI that can do most human tasks. What we don’t have is a way to direct it at scale.

Obey is the executive layer that’s missing.

Organizational Abstraction

Like a VP with 20+ teams. You manage the organization, not the individuals.

Each team’s complexity is abstracted away. You think at the level that matters.

Executive control. Not micromanagement.

Campaigns

Workspaces for unified initiatives. Related projects sharing context.

One campaign might have dozens of projects building in parallel. Each with its own sessions and agents.

Organize at scale.

Complexity Abstraction

Plan every micro decision without actually planning them. The system handles decomposition, quality gates, and execution tracking.

You make high-level decisions. Obey handles the rest.

Abstraction that lets you manage at scale.

Work From Anywhere

TUI first. Then mobile. iPhone, iPad, Android, desktop.

Connect to Obey daemon from any device. Campaigns across machines as if they’re local.

Manage your AI organization from anywhere.

Proven in Production

Daily R&D since March 2025. Patterns extracted from managing hundreds of agents across complex, long-running projects.

Architecture designed for executive-scale AI management. Not theoretical. Battle-tested.

Built by someone who uses it every day.

contact@obediencecorp.com

Infrastructure for autonomous companies.

Obey

Run an AI organization at executive scale.

The Scale

Imagine you’re a VP with 20+ teams of 5-10 people each. That’s 100-200 people. You can’t manage them all directly. You need abstraction.

Obey lets you manage hundreds of agents the same way. Not by tracking each one, but by managing at the right level of abstraction.

How It Works

Campaigns

A campaign is a workspace for a unified initiative. Related projects that share context. One campaign might have dozens of projects building in parallel.

Sessions

Each session can have multiple agents working together. Visualize how they coordinate. Monitor progress. See what’s happening without micromanaging.

Festivals

See festival progress across everything. Know which phase, which sequence, which task. Monitor execution at whatever level makes sense.

What This Enables

Organizational Workflows

Build systems that automate complex organizational workflows. Not just tasks, but how entire initiatives operate.

Executive Decisions

Make high-level decisions. The abstraction handles team-level complexity. You focus on what matters.

Scale Without Overhead

More agents. More sessions. More campaigns. Same mental overhead. The complexity doesn’t grow linearly with scale.

The Result

One person managing what would normally require an entire management layer.

Hundreds of agents. One window. Executive control.

The Scale Problem

Everyone is focused on model intelligence. AGI. Benchmarks. Who has the best reasoning.

That’s the wrong problem.

The Capability Already Exists

Current models can replicate the majority of human tasks. Faster. Often better.

The bottleneck isn’t intelligence. It’s direction.

The Real Problem

We build tools and systems problem-by-problem. AI helps, but that approach only scales so far.

There’s no executive layer. No way to direct thousands of capable subsystems toward a unified goal.

What Obey Provides

A corporate org structure for AI. Break goals into sub-goals. Direct complex systems at scale.

The abstraction hierarchy: - Obey: The organization - Campaigns: Initiatives - Projects: Focused work - Festivals: Task execution

The abstraction goes as deep as needed. Theoretically infinite. Each layer handles its own complexity.

The Result

Not smarter AI. Directed AI.

The intelligence exists. Obey makes it useful at scale.

Organizational Abstraction

VPs don’t manage 200 people directly. They manage at the right level of abstraction.

Obey applies the same principle to AI agents.

The Abstraction

You’re the executive

High-level decisions. Strategic direction. Initiative oversight.

Sessions are your teams

Each session handles its own complexity. Multiple agents working together. You don’t need to track each one.

Campaigns are your divisions

Unified workspaces for related initiatives. Dozens of projects building in parallel with shared context.

What This Enables

Scale without overhead

More agents doesn’t mean more management burden. The abstraction handles the complexity growth.

Right-level thinking

You think about outcomes, not task routing. About initiatives, not individual agent prompts.

Organizational workflows

Build systems that automate how entire initiatives operate. Not just tasks. Entire operational patterns.

The Result

One person managing what would normally require an entire management layer.

The complexity exists. It’s just abstracted at the right level so you can actually manage it.

Campaigns

A campaign is a workspace for a unified initiative. Related projects that share context. The organizational unit that makes scale manageable.

The Structure

Campaign level

The initiative. Your company’s AI infrastructure. A product launch. A research program. Whatever needs unified coordination.

Sessions within campaigns

Each session represents focused work. Multiple agents collaborating on a specific goal. Many sessions can run simultaneously.

Agents within sessions

The actual workforce. Different models, different specializations, all coordinated by the session structure.

What Campaigns Enable

Parallel execution

Dozens of projects building at once. Different sessions, different goals, same campaign context.

Shared knowledge

Context flows between sessions. Decisions in one place inform work elsewhere. No siloed agents.

Cross-machine coordination

Campaigns can span multiple machines. Your desktop, VPS, servers. All appearing as one unified workspace.

The Result

One campaign. Many projects. Hundreds of agents.

All organized, all visible, all manageable from a single view.

Complexity Abstraction

Plan every micro decision without actually planning them.

The Problem

Complex projects have thousands of decisions. Architecture choices. Implementation details. Edge cases. Error handling. Testing strategies.

Planning all of this manually doesn’t scale. You’d spend more time planning than building.

How Abstraction Works

Hierarchical Decomposition

High-level goals decompose into phases. Phases into sequences. Sequences into tasks. Each level handles its own detail.

You define what you want. The system decomposes how to get there.

Quality Gates

Every level has checkpoints. Testing. Review. Validation. Quality is structural, not optional.

You don’t manually verify each step. The structure enforces it.

Execution Tracking

See progress at any level. Know what’s done, what’s in progress, what’s next. All without micromanaging.

What This Enables

Scale Without Complexity

More projects. More parallel work. Same mental overhead. The abstraction handles the growth.

CEO-Level Management

Make high-level decisions. Delegate details to the structure. Focus on what matters.

Consistent Quality

Quality gates run automatically. Nothing ships without passing. No manual checklist required.

The Result

Plan at the level that matters. Let abstraction handle the rest.

You’re the CEO of your agents, not their manager.

Work From Anywhere

Your AI organization shouldn’t be tied to one machine. Obey runs where you run.

Device Agnostic

TUI first

Terminal interface for power users. Keyboard-first. Fast. Where serious work happens.

Mobile follows

iPhone. iPad. Android. Same campaigns, same sessions, same control. Different screen.

Desktop everywhere

macOS. Linux. Windows. The daemon runs on your infrastructure. The client runs anywhere.

Infrastructure Anywhere

Central daemon

Obey daemon runs on your main work machine. The brain of your AI organization.

Remote campaigns

Connect to campaigns running on VPS, other desktops, onsite servers. All appearing local.

Unified view

Doesn’t matter where the compute lives. You see one coherent organization.

The Result

Start work on your desktop. Continue on your iPad. Check progress from your phone.

Your AI workforce runs 24⁄7. You manage it from wherever you are.

Proven in Production

Obey’s architecture emerged from solving real organizational problems. Daily. Since March 2025.

Not theoretical research. Not demos. Patterns extracted from actually running an AI organization.

Real Results

Productivity multiplied

One person managing what would typically require teams. Not marginal gains. Order of magnitude improvement.

Scale validated

Hundreds of agents. Multiple campaigns. Dozens of parallel projects. The organizational model works.

Patterns proven

Campaign structure. Session management. Festival-based execution. All refined through actual use.

Current Status

Core architecture: Proven and working

Festival planning: Complete and operational

What’s next: Unified interface to bring everything together

The hard organizational problems are solved. What remains is packaging them into a cohesive product.

The Result

Infrastructure built by someone who runs an AI organization daily.

Not vaporware. Proven techniques awaiting final packaging.
